doc.field: New York Universities Libraries Archived Website
New York Universities Libraries Archived Website

The NYU Libraries website is made up of information about Bobst Library, built in 1973, resources and affiliate libraries in New York City and abroad. The website contains information on the library's resources and services.

The NYU Libraries website is made up of information about Bobst Library, built in 1973, resources and affiliate libraries in New York City and abroad. The website contains information on the library's resources and services.

The NYU Libraries website is made up of information about Bobst Library resources and affiliate libraries in New York City and abroad. In 2016 the website was redesigned. The website contains information on how to use databases, Bobcat (the library's catalog), floor maps of Bobst, ebooks, journals, Special Collections, course reserves, interlibrary loan, print and copy services, audiovisual materials, study space and computing reservations, borrowing privileges, and other library materials and services. Other resources include research guides, data services, digital studio, citation and formatting tools, teaching support, accessibility services, and Ask a Librarian chat service. The website also has news from the library, stratgic plan, event listings, blog posts highlighting materials and services, and listings of library staff and departments.

In 1973, a major gift from Elmer Holmes Bobst and his wife, Mamdouha, led to the establishment of a new library on Washington Square South, uniting multiple library collection throughout New York University. The library was designed by Philip Johnson and Richard Foster. Additional libraries under the perview of NYU Libraries include the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences Library, Stephen Chan Library of the Institute of Fine Arts, Jack Brause Library at the School of Professional Studies, the Library of the Institute for the Study of the Ancient World (ISAW), Bern Dibner Library at NYU Tandon, the Health Sciences Libraries, the Law Library, and the NYU Abu Dhabi Library and NYU Shanghai Library.
The website was selected for capture by Lorena A. Ramirez-Lopez in January 2016. There is no accession number associated with this website.
guides.nyu.edu, nyu.libcal.com, and bobcat.library.nyu.edu were excluded from the crawl.
Robots.txt (a piece of code designed to limit crawler activity within a website) was ignored with the permission of the content owner.

Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.

If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the special.collections@nyu.edu.

Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.

Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
